org.apache.jackrabbit.core.search
Class RangeQueryNode

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.jackrabbit.core.search.QueryNode
      org.apache.jackrabbit.core.search.RangeQueryNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants
public class RangeQueryNode
extends QueryNode
implements Constants

Implements a query node that defines a range query. The following data types are supported:

  • long
  • double
  • String
  • Date

Version:
$Revision: $, $Date: $

accept

public Object accept(QueryNodeVisitor visitor,
                     Object data)
Description copied from class: QueryNode
Accepts a QueryNodeVisitor and calls the apropriate visit method on the visitor depending on the concrete implementation of this QueryNode.

Specified by:
accept in class QueryNode
Parameters:
visitor - the visitor to call back.
data - arbitrary data for the visitor.
Returns:
the return value of the visitor.visit() call.
See Also:
QueryNode.accept(org.apache.jackrabbit.core.search.QueryNodeVisitor, java.lang.Object)

getLongRange

public long[] getLongRange()
Returns a value array with long boundaries. If this query node is not of type long, null is returned.

Returns:
a value array with long boundaries.

getDoubleRange

public double[] getDoubleRange()
Returns a value array with double boundaries. If this query node is not of type double, null is returned.

Returns:
a value array with double boundaries.

getStringRange

public String[] getStringRange()
Returns a value array with String boundaries. If this query node is not of type String, null is returned.

Returns:
a value array with String boundaries.

getDateRange

public Date[] getDateRange()
Returns a value array with Date boundaries. If this query node is not of type Date, null is returned.

Returns:
a value array with Date boundaries.

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type of this RangeQueryNode. One of: Constants.TYPE_DATE, Constants.TYPE_DOUBLE, Constants.TYPE_LONG, Constants.TYPE_STRING

Returns:
the type of this RangeQueryNode.
